results.title: Images of man
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray and David Roberts
results.brief_description: A study of the various styles of Aboriginal rock art found in Kakadu National Park and Arnhem Land in the Northern Territory. Australian world authority on this subject, George Chaloupka, a field anthropologist with the Museum and Art Galleries Board of the Northern Territory, explains some of the unique and beautiful rock paintings to be found in this area.

results.title: Images of Italy
results.brief_description: A tourist guide through Italy highlighting the major sights in the cities from the historic Palio horserace in Siena, the ancient jousting tournament in Arezzo, Mount Vesuvius, the Isle of Capri, a Milan fashion show and a visit to the Pope’s country residence outside Rome. This is a stylish portrayal of an ancient and fascinating country.

results.title: Images for quartet
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Malcolm Otton and Robert Parker
results.brief_description: Looks at the professional and private lives of the four musicians in the Carl Pini String Quartet (Carl Pini, violin; Gordon Bennet, violin; John Godd, viola; Barbara Woolley, cello) to the music of Debussy and Mendelssohn, and Australian composers Richard Meale and Brian Buggy. Note: A short version of the film ‘String quartet’ made in 1972.

results.title: Images de France. Part 2
results.brief_description: Everyday french..easy…entertaining…effective. This unique video learning technique was evolved by Dr Dickinson, PhD, extensively researched at the University Of London and produced at the Manchester University Television Centre. The course consists of two videos ( each with its own “Viewers Guide” booklet), containing 17 programs. You’ll be involved in amusing conversations and funny dramatic and romantic episodes. In next to no time it seems, you find that you will have absorbed the “feel” of France and can converse fluently in French.

results.title: Images and meaning
results.creator_credit: Video Education Australasia and Alan Woodruff
results.brief_description: The central objective of this program is to encourage students to develop their analytical skills in visual literacy. The program looks at how to analyse the non-print text of newspaper images. Using “The Age” as a case study it examines the production of photography, cartoons and graphic design, the process of choice and editorial decision making, how to critically analyse the meaning of these images and what shapes that meaning. It also informs students about the way media images are generated and deepens theit appreciation of the selective way the world is represented through newspapers. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiary students.

results.title: Images
results.creator_credit: Hemdale Film Corporation, Lions Gate Films, Tommy Thompson and Robert Altman
results.brief_description: Neglected by her husband, an emotionally disturbed woman locks herself away in a world of fantasy. Unable to completely escape reality, her brave attempts to maintain composure ultimately crash with frightening violence. A tense and thrilling drama. Stars Susannah York, Rene Auberjonois, Marcel Bozzuffi, Hugh Millais, Cathryn Harrison.

results.title: Imagery of the mind
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
An animated short about a character using his imagination to fight the boredom of his mundane life.

results.title: Image makers (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Institute of Early Childhood Studies (Waverley, N.S.W.) and Ursula Kolbe
results.brief_description:
Looks at the way children make images and how this helps them explore and cope with the world at large, giving it order and meaning.

Includes footage from the Murawina Aboriginal Education Centre in Redfern, Sydney.

results.title: Image and screen
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Lessons in visual language”.
Notes how advances in technology have created greater realism on the screen. Shows how the definition or clarity of detail of the photographed image can be altered by filters, vaseline and netting. Also explains depth of field and exposure. Narrated by Peter Thomson. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
